_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Attachment to rebirth [sn23.3:1.13]: Any desire, greed, relishing, and craving for form
Any attraction, grasping, mental fixation, insistence, and underlying tendencies
Any desire, greed, relishing, and craving for feeling
Any desire, greed, relishing, and craving for perception
Any desire, greed, relishing, and craving for choices
Any desire, greed, relishing, and craving for consciousness
Any becoming involved, grasping, mental fixation, insistence, and underlying tendencies
Cessation of attachment to rebirth [sn23: The cessation of attachment to rebirth is the cessation of desire, greed, relishing, and craving for form
The cessation of attachment to rebirth is the cessation of attraction, grasping, mental fixation, insistence, and underlying tendencies
The cessation of attachment to rebirth is the cessation of desire, greed, relishing, and craving for feeling
The cessation of attachment to rebirth is the cessation of desire, greed, relishing, and craving for perception
The cessation of attachment to rebirth is the cessation of desire, greed, relishing, and craving for choices
The cessation of attachment to rebirth is the cessation of desire, greed, relishing, and craving for consciousness
The cessation of attachment to rebirth is the cessation of becoming involved, grasping, mental fixation, insistence, and underlying tendencies.
